snippet: In November, 11 rural counties will hold a vote on whether to secede from the state and work to form their own — or maybe join Wyoming.
abstract: Cheyenne Wells Journal; rural Colorado county of Cheyenne Wells, along with 11 other counties, will hold quixotic vote in November on whether to secede and form their own state; voters in area express deep frustration with Colorado's Democratic leaders and increasingly left-leaning politics, bristling at gun control laws, marijuana shops, green policies and steps to embrace gay marriage and illegal immigrants.
lead_paragraph: In November, 11 rural counties will hold a vote on whether to secede from the state and work to form their own — or maybe join Wyoming.

headline.main: Fed Up on the Prairie, and Voting on Seceding From Colorado
headline.print_headline: Fed Up on the Prairie, and Voting on Secession
